meanings.definition: An electronic device that amplifies weak signals before they are sent to a main amplifier.
meanings.sent1: The preamplifiers enhanced the faint sounds from the microphone.
meanings.sent2: The music studio needed preamplifiers to make the recordings louder.
meanings.sent3: The preamplifiers whispered to the main amplifier, 'We'll make you sound great!'
meanings.sent4: Like a detective magnifying tiny clues, preamplifiers bring hidden sounds to light.
meanings.sent5: The preamplifiers acted as secret agents, boosting the signals undercover.

meanings.definition: A piece of equipment used to boost the signal strength of audio or video equipment.
meanings.sent1: The preamplifiers increased the power of the audio system.
meanings.sent2: Musicians rely on preamplifiers to make their instruments sound better.
meanings.sent3: The preamplifiers joked, 'We're the muscles of the sound system!'
meanings.sent4: Just like a chef adding seasoning, preamplifiers spice up the audio signals.
meanings.sent5: The preamplifiers were like superheroes, saving the day with stronger signals.
